trans-unit.source: Create and Deploy a PHP-MySQL web app in Azure App Service using WebMatrix
trans-unit.target: Create and Deploy a PHP-MySQL web app in Azure App Service using WebMatrix

trans-unit.source: A tutorial that demonstrates how to use the free WebMatrix IDE to create and deploy a PHP web app in Azure App Service that stores data in MySQL.
trans-unit.target: A tutorial that demonstrates how to use the free WebMatrix IDE to create and deploy a PHP web app in Azure App Service that stores data in MySQL.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to use WebMatrix to develop and deploy a PHP-MySQL application to <linkText>Azure App Service</linkText><title></title> Web Apps.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to use WebMatrix to develop and deploy a PHP-MySQL application to <linkText>Azure App Service</linkText><title></title> Web Apps.

trans-unit.source: WebMatrix is a free web development tool from Microsoft that includes everything you need for website development.
trans-unit.target: WebMatrix is a free web development tool from Microsoft that includes everything you need for website development.

trans-unit.source: WebMatrix supports PHP and includes intellisense for PHP development.
trans-unit.target: WebMatrix supports PHP and includes intellisense for PHP development.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial assumes you have <linkText>MySQL[install-mysql]</linkText><title></title> installed on your computer so that you can test an application locally.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial assumes you have <linkText>MySQL[install-mysql]</linkText><title></title> installed on your computer so that you can test an application locally.

trans-unit.source: However, you can complete the tutorial without having MySQL installed.
trans-unit.target: However, you can complete the tutorial without having MySQL installed.

trans-unit.source: Instead, you can deploy your application directly to Azure App Service Web Apps.
trans-unit.target: Instead, you can deploy your application directly to Azure App Service Web Apps.

trans-unit.source: Upon completing this guide, you will have a PHP-MySQL website running in Web Apps.
trans-unit.target: Upon completing this guide, you will have a PHP-MySQL website running in Web Apps.

trans-unit.source: You will learn:
trans-unit.target: You will learn:

trans-unit.source: How to create a website in App Service Web Apps and a MySQL database using the <linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: How to create a website in App Service Web Apps and a MySQL database using the <linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Because PHP is enabled in Web Apps by default, nothing special is required to run your PHP code.
trans-unit.target: Because PHP is enabled in Web Apps by default, nothing special is required to run your PHP code.

trans-unit.source: How to develop a PHP application using WebMatrix.
trans-unit.target: How to develop a PHP application using WebMatrix.

trans-unit.source: How to publish and re-publish your application to Web Apps using WebMatrix.
trans-unit.target: How to publish and re-publish your application to Web Apps using WebMatrix.

trans-unit.source: By following this tutorial, you will build a simple Tasklist web application in PHP.
trans-unit.target: By following this tutorial, you will build a simple Tasklist web application in PHP.

trans-unit.source: The application will be hosted in App Service Web Apps.
trans-unit.target: The application will be hosted in App Service Web Apps.

trans-unit.source: A screenshot of the running application is below:
trans-unit.target: A screenshot of the running application is below:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure PHP Web Site</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure PHP Web Site</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to <linkText>Try App Service</linkText><title></title>, where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.
trans-unit.target: If you want to get started with Azure App Service before signing up for an Azure account, go to <linkText>Try App Service</linkText><title></title>, where you can immediately create a short-lived starter web app in App Service.

trans-unit.source: No credit cards required; no commitments.
trans-unit.target: No credit cards required; no commitments.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Download[tasklist-mysql-download]</linkText><title></title> the Tasklist application files.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Download[tasklist-mysql-download]</linkText><title></title> the Tasklist application files.

trans-unit.source: The Tasklist application is a simple PHP application that allows you to add, mark complete, and delete items from a task list.
trans-unit.target: The Tasklist application is a simple PHP application that allows you to add, mark complete, and delete items from a task list.

trans-unit.source: Task list items are stored in a MySQL database.
trans-unit.target: Task list items are stored in a MySQL database.

trans-unit.source: The application consists of these files:
trans-unit.target: The application consists of these files:

trans-unit.source: additem.php: Adds an item to the list.
trans-unit.target: additem.php: Adds an item to the list.

trans-unit.source: createtable.php: Creates the MySQL table for the application.
trans-unit.target: createtable.php: Creates the MySQL table for the application.

trans-unit.source: This file will only be called once.
trans-unit.target: This file will only be called once.

trans-unit.source: deleteitem.php: Deletes an item.
trans-unit.target: deleteitem.php: Deletes an item.

trans-unit.source: getitems.php: Gets all items in the database.
trans-unit.target: getitems.php: Gets all items in the database.

trans-unit.source: index.php: Displays tasks and provides a form for adding an item to the list.
trans-unit.target: index.php: Displays tasks and provides a form for adding an item to the list.

trans-unit.source: markitemcomplete.php: Changes the status of an item to complete.
trans-unit.target: markitemcomplete.php: Changes the status of an item to complete.

trans-unit.source: taskmodel.php: Contains functions that add, get, update, and delete items from the database.
trans-unit.target: taskmodel.php: Contains functions that add, get, update, and delete items from the database.

trans-unit.source: Create a local MySQL database called tasklist.
trans-unit.target: Create a local MySQL database called tasklist.

trans-unit.source: You can do this either from the Database workspace in WebMatrix (after it is installed below in the tutorial) or from the MySQL command prompt with this command:
trans-unit.target: You can do this either from the Database workspace in WebMatrix (after it is installed below in the tutorial) or from the MySQL command prompt with this command:

trans-unit.source: This step is only necessary if you want to test your application locally.
trans-unit.target: This step is only necessary if you want to test your application locally.

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps to create a web app and a MySQL database:
trans-unit.target: Follow these steps to create a web app and a MySQL database:

trans-unit.source: Login to the <linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Login to the <linkText>Azure Portal</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Click the New icon on the bottom left of the portal.
trans-unit.target: Click the New icon on the bottom left of the portal.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create New Azure web site</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create New Azure web site</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Web + Mobile, then Web app + MySQL.
trans-unit.target: Click Web + Mobile, then Web app + MySQL.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Custom Create a new web site</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Custom Create a new web site</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enter a valid name for your resource group.
trans-unit.target: Enter a valid name for your resource group.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Set resource group name</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Set resource group name</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enter values for your new web app.
trans-unit.target: Enter values for your new web app.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create web app</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create web app</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enter values for your new database, including agreeing to the legal terms.
trans-unit.target: Enter values for your new database, including agreeing to the legal terms.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create new MySQL database</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create new MySQL database</linkText>

trans-unit.source: When the web app has been created, you will see the new resource group.
trans-unit.target: When the web app has been created, you will see the new resource group.

trans-unit.source: To connect to the MySQL database that is running in Web Apps, your will need the connection information.
trans-unit.target: To connect to the MySQL database that is running in Web Apps, your will need the connection information.

trans-unit.source: To get MySQL connection information, follow these steps:
trans-unit.target: To get MySQL connection information, follow these steps:

trans-unit.source: From your resource group, click the database:
trans-unit.target: From your resource group, click the database:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Select database</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Select database</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the database sumamry, select Properties.
trans-unit.target: From the database sumamry, select Properties.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Select properties</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Select properties</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Make note of the values for Database, Host, User Id, and Password.
trans-unit.target: Make note of the values for Database, Host, User Id, and Password.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Note properties</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Note properties</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the next few steps you will develop the Tasklist application by adding the files you downloaded earlier and making a few modifications.
trans-unit.target: In the next few steps you will develop the Tasklist application by adding the files you downloaded earlier and making a few modifications.

trans-unit.source: You could, however, add your own existing files or create new files.
trans-unit.target: You could, however, add your own existing files or create new files.

trans-unit.source: Launch <linkText>Microsoft WebMatrix</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Launch <linkText>Microsoft WebMatrix</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: If you haven't alreayd installed it yet, do it now.
trans-unit.target: If you haven't alreayd installed it yet, do it now.

trans-unit.source: If this is the first time you've used WebMatrix 3, you will be prompted to sign into Azure.
trans-unit.target: If this is the first time you've used WebMatrix 3, you will be prompted to sign into Azure.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, you can click on the Sign In button, and choose Add Account.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, you can click on the Sign In button, and choose Add Account.

trans-unit.source: Choose to Sign in using your Microsoft Account.
trans-unit.target: Choose to Sign in using your Microsoft Account.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add Account</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add Account</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you have signed up for an Azure account, you may log in using your Microsoft Account:
trans-unit.target: If you have signed up for an Azure account, you may log in using your Microsoft Account:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Sign into Azure</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Sign into Azure</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the start screen, click the New button, and choose Template Gallery to create a new site from the Template Gallery:
trans-unit.target: On the start screen, click the New button, and choose Template Gallery to create a new site from the Template Gallery:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>New site from Template Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>New site from Template Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the available templates, choose PHP.
trans-unit.target: From the available templates, choose PHP.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Site from template</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Site from template</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select the Empty Site template.
trans-unit.target: Select the Empty Site template.

trans-unit.source: Provide a name for the site and click NEXT.
trans-unit.target: Provide a name for the site and click NEXT.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Provide name for site</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Provide name for site</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Your site will be opened on WebMatrix with some default files in place.
trans-unit.target: Your site will be opened on WebMatrix with some default files in place.

trans-unit.source: In the next few steps you will develop the Tasklist application by adding the files you downloaded earlier and making a few modifications.
trans-unit.target: In the next few steps you will develop the Tasklist application by adding the files you downloaded earlier and making a few modifications.

trans-unit.source: You could, however, add your own existing files or create new files.
trans-unit.target: You could, however, add your own existing files or create new files.

trans-unit.source: Add your application files by clicking Add Existing:
trans-unit.target: Add your application files by clicking Add Existing:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>WebMatrix - Add existing files</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>WebMatrix - Add existing files</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the resulting dialog, navigate to the files you downloaded earlier, select all of them, and click Open.
trans-unit.target: In the resulting dialog, navigate to the files you downloaded earlier, select all of them, and click Open.

trans-unit.source: When prompted, choose to replace the index.php file.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, choose to replace the index.php file.

trans-unit.source: Next, you need to add your local MySQL database connection information to the taskmodel.php file.
trans-unit.target: Next, you need to add your local MySQL database connection information to the taskmodel.php file.

trans-unit.source: Open the taskmodel.php file by double clicking it, and update the database connection information in the connect function.
trans-unit.target: Open the taskmodel.php file by double clicking it, and update the database connection information in the connect function.

trans-unit.source: (Note: Jump to Publish Your Application if you do not want to test your application locally and want to instead publish directly to Azure App Service Web Apps.)
trans-unit.target: (Note: Jump to Publish Your Application if you do not want to test your application locally and want to instead publish directly to Azure App Service Web Apps.)

trans-unit.source: Save the taskmodel.php file.
trans-unit.target: Save the taskmodel.php file.

trans-unit.source: For the application to run, the items table needs to be created.
trans-unit.target: For the application to run, the items table needs to be created.

trans-unit.source: Right click the createtable.php file and select Launch in browser.
trans-unit.target: Right click the createtable.php file and select Launch in browser.

trans-unit.source: This will launch createtable.php in your browser and execute code that creates the items table in the tasklist database.
trans-unit.target: This will launch createtable.php in your browser and execute code that creates the items table in the tasklist database.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>WebMatrix - Launch createtable.php in browser</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>WebMatrix - Launch createtable.php in browser</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Now you can test the application locally.
trans-unit.target: Now you can test the application locally.

trans-unit.source: Right click the index.php file and select Launch in browser.
trans-unit.target: Right click the index.php file and select Launch in browser.

trans-unit.source: Test the application by adding items, marking them complete, and deleting them.
trans-unit.target: Test the application by adding items, marking them complete, and deleting them.

trans-unit.source: Before publishing your application to App Service Web Apps, the database connection information in taskmodel.php needs to be updated with the connection information you obtained earlier (in the Create a web app and MySQL Database section).
trans-unit.target: Before publishing your application to App Service Web Apps, the database connection information in taskmodel.php needs to be updated with the connection information you obtained earlier (in the Create a web app and MySQL Database section).

trans-unit.source: Open the taskmodel.php file by double clicking it, and update the database connection information in the connect function.
trans-unit.target: Open the taskmodel.php file by double clicking it, and update the database connection information in the connect function.

trans-unit.source: Save the taskmodel.php file.
trans-unit.target: Save the taskmodel.php file.

trans-unit.source: Click Publish in WebMatrix.
trans-unit.target: Click Publish in WebMatrix.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>WebMatrix - Publish</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>WebMatrix - Publish</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Choose an existing site from Microsoft Azure.
trans-unit.target: Click Choose an existing site from Microsoft Azure.

trans-unit.source: Select the App Service web app you created earlier.
trans-unit.target: Select the App Service web app you created earlier.

trans-unit.source: Keep clicking Continue until WebMatrix publishes the site to Azure App Service Web Apps.
trans-unit.target: Keep clicking Continue until WebMatrix publishes the site to Azure App Service Web Apps.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to http://[your web site name].azurewebsites.net/createtable.php to create the items table.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to http://[your web site name].azurewebsites.net/createtable.php to create the items table.

trans-unit.source: Lastly, navigate to http://[your web site name].azurewebsites.net/index.php to use the application.
trans-unit.target: Lastly, navigate to http://[your web site name].azurewebsites.net/index.php to use the application.

trans-unit.source: You can easily modify your application by editing the local copy of the site you downloaded earlier and republish or you can make the edit directly in the Remote mode.
trans-unit.target: You can easily modify your application by editing the local copy of the site you downloaded earlier and republish or you can make the edit directly in the Remote mode.

trans-unit.source: Here, you will make a simple change to the heading in in the index.php file and save it directly to the live site.
trans-unit.target: Here, you will make a simple change to the heading in in the index.php file and save it directly to the live site.

trans-unit.source: Click on the Remote tab of your site in WebMatrix and select Open Remote View.
trans-unit.target: Click on the Remote tab of your site in WebMatrix and select Open Remote View.

trans-unit.source: This will open your remote site for editing directly.
trans-unit.target: This will open your remote site for editing directly.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>WebMatrix - Open Remote View</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>WebMatrix - Open Remote View</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Open the index.php file by double-clicking it.
trans-unit.target: Open the index.php file by double-clicking it.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>WebMatrix - Open index file</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>WebMatrix - Open index file</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Change My ToDo List to My Task List in the title and h1 tags and save the file.
trans-unit.target: Change My ToDo List to My Task List in the title and h1 tags and save the file.

trans-unit.source: When saving has completed, click the Run button to see the changes on the live site.
trans-unit.target: When saving has completed, click the Run button to see the changes on the live site.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>WebMatrix - Launch site in Remote</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>WebMatrix - Launch site in Remote</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>WebMatrix web site</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>WebMatrix web site</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: For a guide to the change from Websites to App Service see: <linkText>Azure App Service and Its Impact on Existing Azure Services</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change from Websites to App Service see: <linkText>Azure App Service and Its Impact on Existing Azure Services</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: For a guide to the change of the old portal to the new portal see: <linkText>Reference for navigating the preview portal</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For a guide to the change of the old portal to the new portal see: <linkText>Reference for navigating the preview portal</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.6/en/installing.html
trans-unit.target: http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.6/en/installing.html
